title: NCREC Leandro Bortolon: Resilience of Cropping Systems

tasks.task: Conduct a discussion on building resilience in cropping systems, addressing issues from a challenging drought season in North Dakota.
subtasks: Explain the dry conditions faced in North Dakota's cropping season.
Discuss the importance of increasing organic matter in croplands.
Advocate for reduced tillage to conserve water and minimize evaporation.
Highlight the benefits of cover crops in late summer and fall for soil health.
Mention the need for proper planting depth (versus planting too deep) to avoid soil crusting and ensure crop emergence.
Emphasize the long-term approach to building resilience in cropping systems through sustainable practices like cover cropping.
